data.description: <p>Required Qualifications:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><ul><li>HS Diploma and some advanced level training. </li><li>U.S. Citizenship.</li><li>Have completed progress toward&nbsp;a bachelor&rsquo;s degree in computer science, computer engineering, or a related field.</li><li>Foundational experience in an object-oriented programming language and exposure to software engineering processes.</li><li>Hands on programming experience through coursework and/or prior internships.</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.</li><li>Ability to quickly adapt and learn new technologies and concepts.</li><li>Self-motivated, independent, detail oriented, responsible team-player.</li><li>Strong written and oral communication skills.</li></ul><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Desired Qualifications:</p><p>&nbsp;</p><ul><li>3.0 and above GPA.</li><li>Exposure to Agile software development processes.</li><li>Familiarity with web development frameworks and/or database technologies.</li></ul><p>#PeratonIntern</p> <p>Peraton is seeking a Summer 2026 Software Engineer Intern&nbsp;to support our TMPC program in Santa Clara, CA.Join our TMPC Software Development Team. You&rsquo;ll have the opportunity to work in a collaborative, supportive environment with our full-time staff, allowing you to grow your skills and your career while building your software development experience. You&rsquo;ll work in an Agile software development environment focusing on Information Assurance (IA) and Security to ensure our software and computing environment meet our security requirements. You will support requirements/story development, software architecture and design, and development.&nbsp;This internship is onsite in Santa Clara, CA. We ask that the intern be available to work the duration of the summer (June to August) and commit to working a minimum of 35 hours per week. This program is geared toward technical college students, actively enrolled at a four-year university, who will be rising into their junior or senior years.</p>
